Pre-Game Insights: Denmark will pose a very big challenge for Sweden as the Red and Whites have been really good recently. Their defence have been very strong, on the other hand, Sweden have been quite inconsistent in their last few matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Denmark will look to build some momentum before heading into the Euro 2024 tournament this summer.
Sweden missed out on a spot at the Euros and will look to disrupt Denmark’s preparations.
The most common result of matches between Denmark and Sweden is 1-0. Three matches have ended with this result.
Denmark score 2 goals when playing at home and Sweden scores 1.6 goals when playing away (on average).
Rasmus Hojlund’s large physique allows him to hold play up and include others in the game.
Alexander Isak is a right-footed centre-forward who can lead the front line on his own or work in a centre-forward pairing.
The home team have 1.90 odds in favour of them winning this match, 3.40 odds in favour of the match ending in a draw and Sweden have 3.85 odds in favour of them to win this fixture.
Others: Kasper Hjulmand’s team take on Sweden before Norway clash in International Friendlies.
Victor Gyokeres is out due to injury for Sweden but the rest of the squad is fit for the clash against Denmark.
Predicted Lineup for Denmark (3-4-3): Schmeichel (GK); Andersen, Kjaer, Christensen; Maehle, Hojbjerg, Eriksen, Kristiansen; Skov Olsen, Hojlund, Damsgaard
Predicted Lineup for Sweden (4-2-3-1): Olsen (GK); Krafth, Starfelt, Lindelof, Augustinsson; Cajuste, Olsson; Kulusevski, Forsberg, Elanga; Isak
India: Sony Sports Network, Sony Liv, UK: Premier Sports 2, USA: ESPN, FOX Sports, Nigeria: No Telecast
